Anyone know how to set PATH: tried that path..   next time I login it's got to be set again.

like icarus-c said; also, if you're on the cmdline, you can then type: . ~/.bashrc  that's a period, space, then the path to your .bashrc file) and it will re-run your bashrc so you can confirm it works correctly.

by the way, if you need to wrap quotes around the path (due to a weirdly-formatted directory or whatever) be sure to use double-quotes, not single quotes.  ie, export PATH="$PATH:/new/path/to/add"  I used single quotes one time and ended up with a path of "$PATH" lol.
